text: This research investigates the ethical dilemmas and regulatory dynamics surrounding Artificial Intelligence (AI) concerning data integrity and its societal impact. Through a cross-sectional survey methodology, primary data was gathered from 650 AI professionals across diverse sectors, including developers, data scientists, ethicists, and policymakers. The study explores the associations between regulatory adherence, ethical awareness, professional training, and experience in AI practice with the efficacy of AI implementation and data integrity assurance. Results indicate a significant positive correlation between higher levels of regulatory compliance and perceived effectiveness in AI implementation, as well as between awareness of AI ethics and assurance of data integrity. Additionally, professional training in AI demonstrates a notable impact on social dynamics, emphasizing the importance of ethical considerations, regulatory frameworks, and continuous education in shaping AI development and its societal implications. The study underlines the necessity for adaptable and inclusive regulatory frameworks capable of aligning AI practices with societal values and ethical norms, with future research directions focusing on exploring AI ethics and regulation across diverse cultural contexts and the influence of emerging technologies on AI ethics.
name: new-064
